page.title: 03Ghyll House Farm
page.content: Some of us went to visit Ghyll House Farm which is owned by Mr T. Phillips. The main{tools}that they use are grass cutters and ploughs.Mr Phillips owns about 300 acres and{employs}2 people to look after the land and seasonal workers.The busiest time of the year for them is hay making season as they only grow grass for the{cattle}to graze on.Their farm is a meat breeding farm. They own about 26 cows, which costs Â£500 each to keep for one year Each cow is sold from Â£400 to Â£600. They own 6 rams,6 dogs,800{pheasants, chickens and ducks.All the land that they own is mostly clay,and some land is easy to plough,but some land isn't. Two of their dogs are alsatians and they are guard dogs.
